microbiome
  • Reference
  • Articles

    Community comparisons

    Group-wise comparisons

    A number of methods for microbiota community comparisons have been proposed. For a recent benchmarking study, see Weiss et al. (2017).

    Univariate comparisons

    For individual taxa, diversity indicators etc.

    • Linear mixed effect models
    • Negative binomial test

    Other methods, not implemented here (see Weiss et al. (2017) for a recent survey):

    • ANCOM; claimed to outperform ZIGs; an R package seems to be available
    • Zero-inflated Gaussians (ZIGs) (see metagenomeSeq Bioconductor package)
    • DESeq2 and other advanced methods based on negative binomial

    Multivariate comparisons

    For community-level multivariate comparisons

    • Multivariate linear models (limma)
    • PERMANOVA
